showScoreExcerpt:
"While the dramatic merits and execution of the performance as a whole fall short, there's no denying 'On Your Feet' is a fun, engaging spectacle. The play's moniker launches full force at the end of Act 1...Like a Gloria Estefan concert — which is essentially what 'On Your Feet' turns out to be — there's plenty of feel-good and excitement, but when the fans leave the theater, the conversation isn't likely to expand beyond 'well, that was fun.'"
